alert.note: Alert for Burlington; Mercer; Middlesex; Monmouth (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 10 at 7:37PM EDT until September 11 at 12:00AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of New Jersey...and southeast Pennsylvania... including the following counties...in New Jersey...Burlington, Camden, Mercer, Middlesex, and Monmouth. In southeast Pennsylvania...Bucks. * WHEN...Until 1045 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 736 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly across portions of the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Trenton, Mount Laurel, Ewing, Willingboro, Lumberton, Princeton, Florence, Burlington, Bristol, Mount Holly, Hightstown, and Bordentown. - This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike between exits 4 and 8A. Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 356 and 359. Interstate 95 in Pennsylvania near mile marker 40. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 35 and 76. Interstate 195 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 11. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
